intro: Angraecopsis thomensis, commonly known as the Toménsis Orchid, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom at night. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination by moths. Angraecopsis thomensis is a rare species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
